For the HP resistive-heating studies, the DAC was contained within a custom-built vacuum vessel designed for HP–HT experiments
40 . The DACs were heated using Watlow 240 V (rated at 4.65 W cm −2) coiled heaters wrapped around the outside of the DACs. The temperature was measured using a K-type thermocouple attached to one of the diamond anvils, close to the gasket. The accuracy of the thermocouple on the temperature range covered by the experiments is 0.4%
35, 36 . NaCl powder was included in the sample chamber to act as pressure transmitting medium and pressure marker
41 .
